This exhibition is well laid out and includes man made waterfall as well as fantastic arrays of plants. The dome has a planned walkway route that caters for all ages and abilities to enjoy. Of particular interest for us were the micro orchids. Beauty on a tiny scale! We went in the morning and the crowd was small but later in the day when we returned it was very busy. Get a re-entry stamp when you leave so you can come back the same day.
This is a beautiful garden and feature of Singapore that is truly unique. I enjoyed strolling through and looking at all the elements and interesting aspects of the garden. Definitely worth a visit!

REVIEW_TITLE: Small enclosed place yet can achieve beautiful picture effect
REVIEW_BODY: The place is not big but at all angles of pictures you can get beautiful results. Best for photography.
Great to visit. They labor the global warming retoric heavily. Hope the stalactites and mites aren't real.

Cloud Forest is situated in Gardens Of The Bay and is worth a few extra dollars to cost whilst you are there. It is absolutely beautiful. The 30 metre high waterfall inside the conservatory is simply stunning. The cool mist inside brought us some welcomed relief from the hot Singapore weather. Just another place to visit that Singapore did so well.
Good educational displays. Most of it is probably lost on the tourists but hopefully not on the local school children.

We love coming to cloud forest. When every we are in Singapore we go here. The plants are so beautiful with really nice setup. It’s very busy so if you don’t like crowded places avoid this area. Allow time and don’t wear long skirts as they may get wet. Love this place and looking forward to coming back.
Yes you pay to go in this dome but it’s worth the dollars and the time to just see what can be done when people are passionate about looking after plants and providing a perfect growing environment
Just beautiful and a must see for all who visit Singapore plus the ride around the outside gardens. So we'll themed in different countries of the world.

This is a massive, tall structure, with a tower of landscaped plants representing species from different mountain climate zones. The waterfall which greets visitors on entry is truly amazing, the only downfall is that it creates a backlog of people in the entrance, as they come in and are instantly drawn by the sight. The conservatory is quite cool and damp, I wished I’d brought a light cardigan!

REVIEW_TITLE: Sitting inside the Gardens by The Bays
REVIEW_BODY: Very Environmentally friendly constructed with beautiful landscaping & greens. It's relaxing as well refreshing just to stroll along the entire place and enjoy the serene environment surrounded by wonderful scenaries.
A really nice place to see, amazing effort is being put to keep the garden in an amzing shape. Just mind taking a jacket, it is a little cool inside

We got engaged inside the Cloud Forest during our trip to Singapore, so it holds some very special memories for me.
It's a beautiful garden, very popular with some excellent views.
It's also nice and cool inside which can be some relief from the Singapore heat.
You can buy a combined entry ticket with the Flower Dome. There are other combinations also available.
I would aim to spend 1-2 hours inside as there's lots to see.
NB. Make sure you see the flowers made from Lego. They are very cool and look so realistic.
Came here with with my girlfriend, we were speechless of the beauty of this place! We arrived at 9am and stayed for few hours! Very beautiful and photogenic! A must if you’re in Singapore.
The vegetation and atmosphere within the cloud forest was incredible. The plants on displays are diverse and beautiful. A must see in Singapore!

After visiting the Marina Sands Skypark, we went down to the Cloud Forest dome.
What an incredible feat of engineering, and the array of flowers and plants are mind boggling.
Take your time wandering the paths, taking in the amazing flora, waterfall and take a walk around the raised walkway to get a Birdseye view of the entire dome.
So many species of tropical plants, all displayed in a way that catches the eye and encourages you to linger and learn more. A great respite from the heat and humidity of the day, and what a beautiful place to while away a couple of hours.
If you are planning to visit the Marina Sands Sky Park, make sure you visit the Cloud Forest as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: Really part of Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Visited as part of Gardens by the Bay. Not really sure why it has s separate review. All the same - excellent.

REVIEW_TITLE: Don’t miss the skywalk. It’s a walk above everything.
REVIEW_BODY: After spending 4 hours at the garden by the bay we were delightfully surprised at the change. You walk in and are immediately confronted with a 6 story tall mountain waterfall. Completely covered in green plants and Orchids. We strolled around, my wife in a wheelchair after an injury on our trip. Place was very accommodating with lifts everywhere. We rode to the top then took the skywalk down. Amazing views inside and out. Well worth the short lines and admission. Buy both domes and get a discount.

So good we went twice ! Less busy in the morning in the week. Lift up to the top then you walk down , architecture is amazing as well as the plants!! Went again in the evening when it is lit up and we were there for misting which is eerie

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and very well laid out
REVIEW_BODY: I was extremely hesitant at the $28 SGD entrance fee for the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. Most of the Gardens by the Bay are free and open to the public and I thought I would get my fill of greenery without shelling out the money for a ticket, but I’m glad I did. The Cloud Forest was extremely impressive and as odd as it sounds, I appreciated that there was one path and one direction to walk. It kept the crowds manageable. My only regret is that we went around 5 PM, thinking that we would catch the light show, but that meant it was super crowded. Since the inside is air-conditioned, I think we could have gone earlier in the day and enjoyed the exhibitions with a lot less people around.

A great relief from the humidity. It's lovely and cool inside. Lots of school groups when we were there, and they were quite noisy. Lots of really beautiful displays. A great place to visit for keen gardeners

I wish I could write how great this is as many things in Singapore are.As a disabled person chronic feet neuropathy I found this attraction very anti disabled people.after following the signs for a lift for disabled people all I found was a very long queue by this time I was struggling.i returned to the entrance only to be told I had to go back to use the designated exit.after a lot of conversation including the offer to walk all the way back to the lift and given some vague promise of consideration for priority I gave up and said it’s ok I just miss out and they allowed me to exit via the entrance .so very overpriced to walk past a waterfall then leave.if you have disabilities I wold suggest don’t go on this one.care factor was 2/10.
This was our 3rd visit. Enjoyed it as much as the 1st. Magnificent building with beautiful plants good place to cool off.

We did all three of the gardens by the bay. Floral fantasy, flower dome and cloud forest. Cloud forest was my least favorite. Though all three are beautiful in their own right. We spent an entire day there and could have spent a lot longer. The flowers are beautiful and it is air conditioned thankfully but after a full day of walking you are tired.
Worth every penny. Great way to spend time in Singapore. I will not spoil it by explaining what you will see, but I cannot recommend highly enough. 5 + stars.....
A wonderful place to visit as part of the entire visit to the Gardens by the Bay. Try to catch the misting at select a time such as 2 PM. Stand on the walkway overlooking the structure.
Amazing place. So well kept and with such a variety of plants. Well set out and with plenty of staff to help when needed . Not to be missed . However best during the day, and not at night.
We loved visiting the Cloud Forest 😍. Everything in Singapore is so stunningly beautiful. Definitely worth a visit! Especially for the pictures!

REVIEW_TITLE: Not if you are afraid of heights!
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place to visit, well worth doing and taking your time. I took loads of photos with my camera but none on my phone but the plants and flowers are really stunning.
As part of visit to Gardens by the Bay. Don't miss. Well worth it and fantastic views through dome as well.

I love nature but hate to be in Hot Humid places. So this place solves my problem. I really feel like sleeping overnight there if they would allow sleeping here. Cool & Lovely place to learn more about nature...

Spent a couple of hours here.
A well laid out and easy climb to the top.
The Waterfall and artificial mountain inside the dome is fantastic.
I'm not much of a plant person, but it was very interesting to see, smell and about the varieties that have been planted and their uses.
There is some very interesting and well presented information about how we as humans are slowly eroding away our resources, warming up the planet and ways we might be able to reduce or reverse some of the damage.
Interesting to know that both glass domes are self sufficient for their cooling and water requirements, owing to the way they were designed.
Well worth visiting.

Cloud forest is pretty cool to see! The waterfall is the first thing that you’ll see as you enter. You’ll make your way up to the top then follow the walkway down through the levels to the bottom. A great forest to explore your way through!
A visit to Singapore will not be complete with the visit of the rain forest. Not only for Singapore itself but also for the knowledge you will get about rain forests all over the world
Worth more than the entry fee. Lots to see and the walk around worth the effort. Lots of people but easy to get around.

Well worth a visit and very fascinating, a very educational message on the climate change impact we’re doing to the world that’s totally contradicted in the gift shop that you have to walk through which is full of unnecessary plastic packaging! Even the books are covered in plastic!

I have mentioned the Cloud Forest in my review if Gardens by the Bay.

Truly awesome - from the huge waterfall which faces you on entering the dome.

The dome was a very pleasant retreat from the humidity outside.

The plants and trees along with many if the exhibitions are fascinating along with a huge number of wonderful art installations mainly of wood.

Must see
Extraordinary and if I visit nothing else in Singapore it was worth coming here just for the incredible experience of climbing the forest mountain. Wonderful. An absolute must visit.
A wonderful city for a few days rest and relaxation. Singapore is a must for any couple to chill out.
Having gone to both the Botanical/Orchid gardens and the Cloud Forest, we enjoyed this more. Beautiful flowers and foliage and cool inside to boot!
Even my partner who doesn’t like gardening was impressed. Well laid out, easy to get around, awesome views, oh and the plants were impressive too.
This is a must to visit the 2 domes, lots to see and experience, stunning views. Walking and lifts available, gets very busy.

Flower dome & cloud dome are the two domes that dominate the skyline next the super trees in the gardens by the bay. Entry to each can be purchased at the visitor centre. If you enter via the overpass from Marina bay sands hotel there is a small visitor centre on the right where you can purchase tickets for the shuttle bus which takes you to the main area of the park. However it is only a five minute stroll along the well signed posted paths to find your own way. Tickets for both domes cost $28 each. Both domes are well worth a visit and even during the weekend when busier it is still a pleasurable experience.
My husband wanted to visit here and i can see why, it was lovely and well set up. It just take a lot of work to keep in good condition and was very well set up. Great visit to do.

Entering this space is uplifting. The colours and the scent of flowers are beyond anything i experienced before.There are areas to sit and contemplate and watch the beauty of the flowers and.how they are presented in this special place.
Best attraction of Singapore along with flower done,lord of greenry with a water call and observation deck on level 5,good indoor place to enjoy greenry in plesant environment.
Really enjoyed this attraction. So well put together. Only thing for us was not allowing enough time for the visit.

This is a must see attraction and part of the Garden by the Bay area that’s is just amazing, Photo’s don’t do this place justice but I tried with my ultra wide lens. Take a jumper with you to wear because it’s not hot inside. Enjoy
This is a beautiful place to visit and you will not be disappointed combined with a visit to the rest of the gardens by the bay displays.
As a person being afraid of heights I can highly recommend to go. Never in my life seen inside the building mountain of plants, food paths, waterfall!
Want to escape the heat? Go here and enjoy the coolness - which is unlike the real jungle :) . Great walk and loved the flowers and smell.

We bought the ticket allowing us to go in both the domed garden attractions and were blown away on how good they were. We are not huge fans of garden plants etc but still really enjoyed how the gardens had been created to such a beautiful effect.

The waterfall central attraction is fantastic and so are the walkways you get to from the top. I’m not a great fan of heights but I was OK with it.

When I bought the tickets for 28 SGD each I thought that it was expensive - now I’ve been to the attractions I can easily see that this is actually good value.

Loved it!
Must see place, like stepping into a rain forest. Many levels, easy access, abundance of plant life.

I didn’t know what to expect but was pleasantly surprised by the cloud forest. The walk up to the top of the waterfall is pretty and has interesting features scattered all around the paths. A nice few hours of peace and air conditioning 😁

The Cloud Forest is unique. As you enter this cool rainforest you are surprised by the height of its interior waterfall. I recommend that you then take the elevator to the top floor and work your way down. As each ramp weaves through the cloud forest you will learn about different plants at each height of this ecosystem. Their numerous wooden carved works of art capture your attention as much or more than the plants itself.
I’ve never seen anything like this before a truly well designed and serviced a place that has to been enjoyed when coming to Singapore

Very interesting place to visit. Although after a while you find it all looks the same and it feels like you are just shuffling through with the crowd.

We were there when the fog was turned off. I didn’t realise it wasn’t always on. As we didn’t have time to return we missed out on seeing the cloud effect.

We visited the cloud forest and flower dome together. Both were equally amazing. The cloud forest with it's waterfall and greenery was refreshing and the flower dome with bursts of colour. There was an orchard extravaganza where you could smell the sweet fragrances up close. It was a good day out for us.

The Cloud Forest is amazing! With a huge waterfall, a skywalk with fabulous views of the Marina Bay Sands & the city. The sculptures are fantastic. Don't know how they do it. There's so much to look at, it's very well done.
A must visit in Itenerary of Singapore. Best time to visit after 4 pm. Amazing collection of trees and orchids. Mist and sunlight keep the flora and fauna alive.
So cool inside when you walk through the areas. Green, waterfall, many kinds of flowers, trees..make into one as a small world of the green land. A must visit if you are in Singapore
Visited here as part of our walk around the Marina Bay gardens. Entry was SGD 20 each & well worth the price. Welcome relief from the heat outside.
This is a part of the garden and just on the right of flower dom. It look more attractive and have good view for picture. Recommended to visit this place.
We loved the Cloud Forest. The waterfall is a must-see and be sure to look out for the wooden sculptures amongst the foliage.
Cloud Forest was absolutely awesome, we loved it, and hopefully we will be back again some time in the near future, Thank You

Visted both the Flower and Cloud Dome and I found this my favourite out of the two.
Visit late afternoon so you can time it to visit the light show right next door at 7.45 pm.
Best part is the beautiful waterfall make sure you go to the top and walk around the tree tops.
No visit is complete if you don't vist the domes.

REVIEW_TITLE: Marvelled with the idea and construction of Cloud Forest
REVIEW_BODY: Will visit again. Although crowded, but the temperature inside was cool. Could have been better if the floor is not too wet. Kids are visiting. One kid slipped and got very messy.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic visit and suitable for all!
REVIEW_BODY: I have been here before and it is certainly a must see when in Singapore. Inside you will find an amazing garden and climate control, meaning you may even need a cover up as it got pretty cold for me inside. There is no place in the world like it!!

REVIEW_TITLE: Once in a lifetime visit. Once in a lifetime is enough. Bring winter clothing
REVIEW_BODY:
Technically type of visit was "family without kids", not "couples", because we were with his parents and extended family member, all in their 50s and 60s so couldn't select "Family with Teenagers".

Very cold and it was drizzling. Luckily I was prepared with winter clothing. Bring at least autumn clothing.

Visit together with the flower Dome, else it is not really worth going to.

We thoroughly enjoyed visiting the cloud forest after walking through the rest Gardens by the bay. This place is cool and refreshing. Would highly recommend leaving this towards the end of your visit at the Gardens... Especially if you are visiting around day time because it can get very warm and humid outside. The cool, temperature controlled cloud forest is just the perfect final destination at the gardens.
Beautiful garden and a wonderful way to spend some time out of the heat of Singapore. It is always beautifully maintained and the facility is amazing - a must see.
Beautiful waterfall right as you step in then head up and see different exhibits doesn’t take long to walk through the different areas. Great spots for photos throughout cloud forest.

Well done Singapore for showing what man is capable of...

The Cloud Forest is a magical indoor kingdom. A rain forest under a large glass structure, complete with a large waterfall and must every two hours.

We bought the combination ticket with the Floral Dome but the large Cloud Forest was the comfortable winner.

The scale and volume of plant life is mind blowing. One gets the best sense after taking the elevator to the top of the dome, following which one wanders down the ramps through the dome and greenery.

An extraordinary experience, for a reasonable admission fee.

A must in Singapore.

This was truly brilliant, take your time and enjoy. There is a lot to see and take in, from the scupltures hidden away, to the unique gardens. Some areas can get a little congested, so be patient. This is well worth a visit.

This was probably my favorite thing we did in Singapore besides eat amazing food. We enjoyed this dome the most out of our time at Gardens by the Bay. The gardens are beautiful and well designed and it was not too crowded on a Sat early afternoon to be unenjoyable though I wouldn’t try not to go when it is very crowded. I loved the different levels to view the garden, the orchid smelling exhibit and the views outside the dome while enjoying the gardens.

This definitely is a must visit place. The ticket you buy also allows you into the flower garden next store. Very scenic inside. We ended up coming on a weekend and it was really crowded. About a 25 minute wait to take the elevator up. It’s best to time your visit so you can see the Super Grove Trees light show at 7:30pm shortly after (maybe dinner in between).

Like most attractions, it dumps you off in the gift shop at the end. Snack bar right outside of the gift shop.

Many others have described what is in the Cloud Dome and I agree with the comments - it is amazing whar the architects/designers have created here. There is so much to look at and experience especially in a cool enviroment. I particularly enjoyed trying to spot the different plants in the main structure and the orchid display proved interesting especially pointing out that some species have a smell which I didn't realise.

This attraction is great for all ages and along with the flower dome I can recommend a visit for all ages.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing especially on a hot day.
REVIEW_BODY: You must visit these gardens. You won't be disappointed. The designers have done a fantastic job in building the display and the structure itself is amazing.

This was our third visit (over a number of years) and remains impressive. Remember a light jacket if you feel the cold, it is lovely and cool inside. The viewing platforms and walkways give a fabulous view overlooking the high waterfall and trees. There is a lot of fascinating information around the centre and the gardens are superbly maintained.

I highly recommend visiting the cloud forest in Singapore. It was a very hot and humid day, but the cloud forest was an oasis from the heat. The garden is well presented and the aerial walkways give beautiful views of the various plants.
The displays here change regularly and when we went the focus was on orchids. Beautiful and well displayed
So the Cloud Forest is part of Gardens by the Bay but you pay separately so you don't have to go in but it would be silly not to. Another must see. Singapore has soo many amazing places.

Gardens by the Bay, Cloud Forest. Inside a monolithic greenhouse-like glass dome is a manmade-mountain. Towering, majestic waterfalls, perfect misty conditions – can get wet if you venture too close in getting the perfect selfie! I have gait/walking challenges (stroke), all sightseeing has to be well-researched and not overly taxing; I wear a legbrace. Start at the top, a steel-mesh walkway leading forwards to descend; look out from glass windows of the dome – silhouetted outside are impressive Marina Bay Sands hotel, Singapore Flyer, Supertree Grove. Many exotic trees, shrubs, rare plants in one place, jet-blasts of water-vapour at intervals - misty, tropical surroundings. Too many sights to do in GBTB; we picked 2 or 3, as we only had a short stopover. Train, bus, taxi, various ways to get there. Well worth it.
Another must do while visiting Singapore. We spent a good two to three hours here and intend to revisit.

A truly amazing place to see all the plants and trees from around the world as you walk the walk ways that tower above the greenery. A very unique building that can house this exceptional collection of flora

This large dome within the gardens, houses a massive 35 metre manmade waterfall and mountain upon which there is a planted tropical rainforest - certainly gives a good impression of one & the spray from the waterfall aids the whole atmosphere. Worth a visit whilst in the gardens.
Stunningly beautiful if you are a gardener you cannot miss this it is worth the money. We spent the whole day at the marina bay gardens and visited all 3 attractions.

We loved the Cloud Forest so much we had to return for a second visit. The plants and the walkways through them a just amazing. And I was delighted to see 2 plants from home (Kentia Palm & Norfolk Island Pine)

This is a must do!
I've been dying to visit the gardens by the bay and the cloud forest lived up to all my wildest expectations.
If you have a passion for horticulture, love biodiversity or just enjoy the beauty of nature, then this is the place for you.
The waterfall upon entrance will blow your mind and I easily spent over an 1 hour 30 mins slowly walking through every inch of this work of art!!

The cloud forest was the best dome we visited of them all.

We were honestly blown away by the cloud Forest. We just presumed that you walk around the outside and that’s it but we were so wrong! You make your way all the way up, literally through the clouds. There’s so much to see here. We really enjoyed ourselves!
The queues can be scary, but they moved pretty quickly, and it was definitely worth the wait. The balconies provide fantastic views, and the lego display was really impressive too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Much to see but take your walking shoes and stay dry!
REVIEW_BODY:
We thoroughly our second visit to the Cloud Forest. It was interesting to see how much many of the trees had developed since we had made our first visit two years ago.
This visit occurred in the middle of the afternoon on a Monday and the Cloud Forest was quite crowded. The admission price for both the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest are quite substantial. Fortunately we had our attraction passes as part of our Singapore Airlines Holidays stopover package and these provided us with free admission to both of these attractions.
The first thing that you come to after entering the Cloud Forest is the massive indoor waterfall. It is important to be careful where you stand to take your photographs as if you stand in the wrong spot, you will soon find yourself getting quite wet. We found it difficult to get good photos as it was relatively dark with grey clouds overhead and there were many others waiting their turn to pose in front of the waterfall.
If you wish to make the most of your visit to the Cloud Forest, there is a substantial amount of walking to be done up inclined and winding walkways. You can make it a bit easier on yourself, as we did by using the lift to access some of the walkways at the higher levels.
Whilst the Cloud Forest is certainly an amazing attraction at the Gardens by the Bay, we enjoyed the Flower Dome more simply because the displays there were more colourful.
Go early for good pics! A beautiful place and a wonderful concept. Worth the visit but be aware that you're unlikey to get that single, clear shot as people tend to do full on photo shoots here!

This place really is magic. No matter where you look there is something picture worry. I’d definitely recommend this exhibit over the flower garden if you only have time and the budget for one. I really enjoyed our time in here. Plus, it was way cooler than the temp outside.

There's so much to admire from this conservatory, such as its stunning design, the orchid display, the huge indoor waterfall and to the high walkways. I found there to be a real sereneness to the attraction and this is where I spent most of my time at Gardens by the Bay. Well worth the entrance fee.

I didnt really know what to expect but the cloud forrest dome was beathtaking. As soon as you enter you have this amazing waterfall infront of you. You can walk around the walkways and escalators to get to the two platforms for views looking down from the waterfall. There other amazing displays there and of course beautiful views over Singapore. The cost to enter this dome and the flower dome was S$28 for both.
Great adventure to walk around this manmade tower of exotic plants with views over the bay and harbour from the treetop walkway.
water fall is the main attraction here, rest is pretty normal. But how they have presented the idea is excellent. Avoiding the rush hours will increase the value of the experience.
Don't even think about it - go. Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are works of vision, brilliantly executed. Interesting and comfortable - incredibly, these huge domes are all air conditioned.

REVIEW_TITLE: Too many people, really not worth it
REVIEW_BODY: It’s really just a very, very crowded greenhouse, if you want to save your time and money go to the airport’s Jewel, it’s similar and without the gigantic crowds
The best part of Gardens by the Bay. Relaxing even when full of people. Wish I could back again and again!
Part of the Marina Bay Gardens, contains a stunning waterfall which can be viewed from different levels. Containing plant species from the rainforest regions of the world.

We thoroughly enjoyed wandering through the Cloud Forest. The amount of work to create and upkeep this area would be incredible. It was just lovely, the waterfall and so many interesting little places created by amazing plants and sculptures. We didn't get to go to the top of the waterfall as the line was too long, but thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

I was somewhat reluctant to spend the entry fee and line up in the line to get into this venue but wow was it worth the visit!!! From the moment you walk in and are greeted by the massive waterfall this venue is nothing but impressive!! The huge wall of plants is hard to comprehend and so so beautiful! There is a second line to get up the top to walkway that shows off the impressive glass dome glass house and meanders around the plants but again was worth the wait (we got through in about 10 minutes in the evening). This was probably my favourite attraction in Singapore and I would definitely recommend checking it out. I would say arrive earlier in the day to avoid to crowds though! Allow about an hour for the whole walk.
From the moment you walk in your breath is taken away with an amazing waterfall. The layout and exotic plants and flowers on display are a gardeners paradise. Worth the time.
This was the best thing I’ve ever done in Singapore. Totally worth the visit. Amazing architecture & design of the building. A perfect backdrop to some beautiful flowers.

REVIEW_TITLE: A relaxing, cool setting to visit while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is part of the Gardens by the Bay complex. Both the Cloud Forest AND Flower Dome offer a very relaxing, beautiful and serene setting to spend 2-3 hours and at the same time get out of the extreme heat and humidity. In fact you may want to bring a light jacket because the Cloud Forest ( that is adjacent to the Flower Dome) is very cool at all times. There are other things to do at Gardens by the Bay but these two are the highlights. You need to buy separate tickets for both locations.
Its beautiful and worth every penny. From the moment that you walk in you feel you are in some beautiful rain forest and the experience just continues all the way. Magic place

REVIEW_TITLE: More than we could have imagined
REVIEW_BODY:
We hadn't really researched the cloud forest before our trip and were expecting a giant greenhouse that you can stroll through.
We were shocked at the magnitude of this structure. It was breathtaking! We spent hours in here, just wandering around. There is so much to see and loads of interactive displays. It was a very informative and relaxed afternoon.
Also a lovely break from the hot weather :)

Loved loved loved this. I was truly surprised with how much I enjoyed the Cloud Forest. Even though it was very crowded, it was so well organised that the crowds weren’t an issue. The wood carvings amongst the plants were amazing. It was a lovely cool escape too. So luscious and green and beautiful flowers and plants. More than just a garden, it really is a forest with little surprises around every corner. The educational movies and displays at the end were also extremely well done. We pre bought our tickets on Klook so no queuing. Definitely a must visit place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Within the wonderful (pay to enter) Marina Gardens!
REVIEW_BODY: Have no concern about paying the entrance feenasnthis experience is wonderful! Hi speed lift to the top and amazing, spray filled views!

The idea itself is very good. Very nice plants. But!
1. Stalactites are prohibited to touch. Why do not put just one for touching? It really do not will damage anything. People come here to have fun, to have impressions, and not touching such things - just a torture, especially for children.
2. Very poor staff in crystal room. Only amethysts, stalactites... and that's it! Why do not make here a real mineral museum with stunning crystals, minerals, stones?
3. Why do not make a place for bathing in the water pool? For children it would be real fun, for adults as well.
4. Why do not make more bridges, caves, cozy sitting places?
etc.

Very poor fantasy. Hire me and I will do a fantastic place from that boring place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful but extremely poor crowd control
REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest was beautiful. No doubt about it. But was it worth it? 6 July 2019, There was a 30 minute queue to enter the cloud forest, and a 1 hour queue to enter the lift in the cloud forest. Crowd control was extremely inadequate. Security officials turned a blind eye to queue cutting and patrons were left to enforce the queue themselves.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very unique, but it’s cold inside
REVIEW_BODY: This really is one of the most spectacular attractions I’ve ever visited. Inside the glass and steel dome, locked away from the climate outside, is this huge mountain, with an equally huge waterfall. Go strait up the mountain and enjoy the views. However... the waterfall (and aircon) make the air very cool or even cold at the top. Take long sleeves or a light jacket. Slowly make your way back down the mountain, enjoying the plants and displays along the way. Then savour the luxury of the tropical river at the bottom. Truly wonderful!
This was by far the best of the two domes. We did this one second and I’d recommend that order, if you do one just visit here. It is full to bursting with orchids and a great atmosphere inside!
I have never seen anything like it. We saw it both in the day time and at night and both are just as spectacular. Views over the city were fantastic as well. A definite must.
A true wow! The design, set up and the display are simply outstanding.A combination of learning, exposure to nature and it's beauty. The plants, flowers and other exhibits are amazing.
Excellent place for visiting with friends and family. various types of plants are grown by them. and the waterfall. I love this place
A well maintained attraction in singapore near Gardens by the bay. Not exactly a must visit. Quite avoidable if you are on a short visit.
Really love it there. Visiting it occasionally in a long while still always feels like the first time of visit. Fascination and awe.
Worthwhile visiting this place, it offers beautiful and scenic plant visions, set in an interesting and attractive display arrangement.

Was excited to see the indoor waterfall in real life after seeing so many photos before my visit.. it didn’t disappoint! It’s not easy trying to get a photo as everyone’s trying to do the same but it really is amazing.
Lovely relaxing stroll around stunning gardens, Everywhere you look you will see something beautiful, So much to look at.

REVIEW_TITLE: Keep it for the Rainy Day in Singapore- Beautiful
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful unique indoor experience . Keep it for a rainy day in Singapore and combine it with the Gardens and Marina Bay Sands
This dome enables you to walk around a cascading waterfall and walls of plants. The walkway is quite high and creates a feeling of actually being in a cloud forest...well worthwhile.

I had no idea what to expect of this as I did not pre look at photos, & I’m glad I didn’t. We were instantly struck by the magical quality of the water fall as you walk in. The entire garden space is so impressive. The only partial negative is the waiting time to get up to the top to make your way back down again.

A unique experience! The waterfall gives the dome its magic and makes the indoor climate nice. Make sure you go to the top of the waterfall and pass thru every experience when you go down from 1 floor to the other.

Amazing nice & cool aircon, which was a pleasure as Singapore is so humid so is a nice break from the heat outside. The walk ways are a great way to see all the plants waterfalls etc.... @ various different heights. The flower is really good to but the cloud forest was my favourite, we went in the flower dome first then the Cloud forest dome In recommend doing it in this order.
This is like walking in into a dream world. Plants you cannot beleive in a spectacular environment. Very satisfactory but unfortunately too crowded to be able to enjoy fully.

A big air conditioned glass dome with an indoor waterfall, plants and too many visitors. Can get a bit too annoying especially near the entrance which flaunts an indoor waterfall. Has an entry fee and closing time.
Great place to visit. Showing different aspects of the world. It took lots of imagination to create this.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Forest that is a great place to cool down!
REVIEW_BODY: Besides the incredibly stunning plants, flowers and waterfall, this place is air conditioned which was an amazing respite from the outside humidity.

REVIEW_TITLE: A little too crowded to appreciate fully.
REVIEW_BODY: This is no doubt a spectacular venue and would be very serene with fewer people than we experienced. We did go on an evening at a very popular time so we should have anticipated a lot of people. We did spend a lot of time trying not to walk into photographs which did distract a little from our enjoyment of the surroundings. It was hard to stop and just take in the experience without getting in the way of other people. The entry fee is quite expensive so I couldn't really suggest we got good value. We were glad we went, although but if we had picked our time more carefully I think it would have been much better. I recommend going at a quieter time of the day.

What a stunning and beautiful experience it was to go the cloud forest. The effort that must go into maintaining such a beautiful attraction is unbelievable! The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The gardens were amazing! Would totally recommend people check this place out if they have time

Just an amazing place to visit. Not only do you get away from the sweltering heat of outside but you get to see some beautiful plants. The sculptures dotted around were really interesting too and really added to the whole experience.

The walkways are high but you feel perfectly safe on them.

Highly recommended.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Awareness Center about the climate Change
REVIEW_BODY: This is a part of the Gardens by the Bay. It developed as a large green house. You can enjoy the time you spend there by natural beauties and the recent facts about our planet.

I visited the Cloud Forest last year with some friends and was keen to take my girlfriend this year as she had never been, I loved it just as much the second time and she was blown away by how impressively gorgeous every little detail of the Cloud Forest was.

REVIEW_TITLE: A man made waterfall that looks more natural
REVIEW_BODY: The vertical green forest looks more amazing with the water falling in full flow. The little drops falling on you makes your senses fresh and energetic at the same time.

Absolutely first-rate experience, worth every penny of admission. Plan to relax and take your time to soak it all in and enjoy. Come early on a weekday if at all possible otherwise the crowds are challenging.
To be honest thought I may get bored , far from it , trip was good particularly the light show. Interesting to see what we're doing to our planet
Spectacular attraction - can get quite busy but totally worth it. We did this in the late afternoon prior to the light show and seeing it all lit up was something special

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see when you visit Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest houses the worlds tallest indoor waterfall and an exquisite range of tropical and rain forest plants. We were delighted to see they even had one of Australia's rare Wollomi Pines trees and the most gorgeous collection of orchids were on display when we were there. There are stalagmites, stalactites and crystals amethyst caves. Fascinating and interesting. We loved it.

This was an amazing experience. There is so much to view and discover in Cloud Forest.
It is extremely well done, with the plant life seemingly integrated into the structure naturally. You do wonder how some of the gardening and maintenance is performed.
Please make sure to allow yourself sufficient time to explore properly.

Visited here often when I had the annual pass. Recently visited here since the cost of this ticket with Flower Dome is more value for money. Nice waterfall, and "trekking" comfortably in the aircon. Very well-trained and organized staffing at elevators to guide visitors. Great for kids, nice skybridge.

I didn't think I'd enjoy this as much as I did. It really was an incredible thing to experience -- the waterfall, the abundance of plants in there, the genius design of it all, some of the tranquil spots at the base... Definitely worth visiting. (Also, it was air-conditioned inside -- bonus!)
With so many levels to explore and so many statues and plants ,this dome is much more than we thought. Another must do in Singapore
Hidden in amongst the lush greenery were some fabulous driftwood type sculptures and we loved climbing up 'inside' the waterfall.

Must visit place, the waterfalls is in front of you once step in the Cloud Forest, it is very attractive one, understand why so many people will spend a quite of time to picture taking there. Cool place and the vertical flower is beautiful, feeling very touching they will close the Dome one day for monthly maintenance.
I “must do” when in Singapore, but unless a botanist, it’s pretty but not too exciting. The waterfall at the start is lovely.
natural air conditioning, cool place with many plenties variances of plants. please come on weekday or not peak season time so you can have time to more explore it.

We ended up here because a storm fell on us right at that time and it was impossible to leave the area, so we paid the pricey ticket for both natural spaces.
This ended up being quite entertaining , instructive and pretty actually. Something I would recommend, also if you travel with children as it stresses the importance of the environment and its protection.

Hello traveller!

Cloud Forest is lovely to view and walk through. However, the ticket price was not worth the 5 min visitation as the location is small. If you choose to go to Cloud Forest you are "forced" to buy entry into two places. I get it, but also from the perspective of a traveller - umh, felt weird.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Cloud Forest itself is great but try to avoid crowds
REVIEW_BODY: The attraction itself is great and interesting, but the elevator to the top of the Forest gets heavily crowded during peak hours. SO might be good idea to visit early.
This was one of our favorite gardens we've ever visited. So beautiful and even better than expected.

Fantastic, beautiful words can’t describe how wonderful the cloud gardens are. My best advice is try to avoid going here on a weekend as it can be crowded but the gardens are so great you won’t mind wasting. The dome is air conditioned and very comfortable. Make sure to spend time about the different types of orchids.

We did this with gardens by the bay, it is well worth paying to do all 3 activities as they are all fantastic, it takes a time to see all and we stopped for coffee and a cake at a nice little cafe in the park.
A must to see when in town and we did it about 9.30 and easy to get to by taxi.

Words can not express how fantastic this is. Singapore have mastered the rain fall of greenery not only in this spectacular place but at the botanical gardens The Park royal hotel is the same. It’s a must see and it’s Air con makes it all very easy to walk through.

I never tire of visiting the cloud forest. There is something magical about this place. It is one of the reasons we stop in Singapore every chance we get. We were fortunate to smell the fragrant orchid display. What a sensory delight. I applaud the Singaporean’s on their ingenuity and their obvious love for all things beautiful. A must to see.
Nice cool way to view a forest. Good for a leisure stroll in hot humid Singapore. Suitable for couple, group of friends, family or corporate gathering.

It was a nice experience that we had in our visit. The waterfall in the entrance is pleasant to watch, climbing up and seeing it from top is as well. The design and architecture is very well done. It takes around 45 minutes inside.

REVIEW_TITLE: Green place to be on a hot hot day
REVIEW_BODY: Last I remembered, it was far less crowded before and it was a very pleasant experience. On my last visit, there was a line to go up. The sky bridge was full of photo folks and we had to stop ever so often. My best advice is the avoid the peak period. During my time of visit, it was early evening just before the light show. Overall, still a great place to visit and stay cool.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool in more ways than one.
REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest can get very busy from 4pm onwards so we headed there around 2pm and avoided the crowds. Stunning dome packed with plants, orchids and complete with its own waterfall which also helps keep it cool. Once inside you can catch a lift up to the top floor and the work your way down via the platform paths. A must see in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful but with huge crowds and very long lines
REVIEW_BODY: It seems we went during peak period as our experience was mostly spent shuffling along a very long line, looking up occasionally at this beautiful man-made sculpture in front of us. We don't do well in crowds, so we hopped out of the line after 20 minutes of shuffling. The lines were mostly orderly with staff in attendance to show us where the exit was and they were very nice and helpful. I would not recommend bringing young children during peak periods as they'll get crushed or will get tired. It's a very long wait to get to the top.
You walk the downstairs through in three minutes. There is a lift to upstairs, but the line was over 20 minutes long, so we skipped it.

Whilst visiting the gardens we bought a combined ticket for the flower dome and cloud forest.
It did feel slightly like a Disney attraction, as there is a set route that everyone walks and although we went fairly early, can imagine in busy times it could get very crowded.

The planning effort that went into this project is truly amazing, there is so much to see, we spent 5 hours inside this magnificent dome. Full credit to Singapore for designing such a beautiful structure. This is a must do.

A wonderful experience of being in a rain forest environment with some of the most beautiful plants round every corner. You can go higher and higher to be behind the high waterfall. We spent a lot of time in Cloud Forest enjoying everything about it.
Going to Singapore the cloud Forest is a must to amaze anyone.the marketing that has gone into this is fantastic. Something I will never forget

What an amazing experience! My husband and I had a stop over in Singapore on the way back home and were so lucky to be able to experience this beauty. From the tall waterfall, to the amazing plants on offer. Refreshing and relaxing throughout.

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular indoor gardens with massive waterfall.
REVIEW_BODY: Cloud Forest is spectacular! It is a massive indoor garden with a very big waterfall. We got some great photos..
Definitely a cool place to visit in the Marina Bay area. Air conditioned so nice break if you go mid-day. Many orchids to smell, great photo ops and overall well curated.

REVIEW_TITLE: Deceptively big - Carnivorous plants - Amethysts, etc.
REVIEW_BODY: At first sight, you think it is only a large "mountain" but soon realize that it will take a good hour to enjoy all areas and aspects of this forest. Don't miss the movie at the end. Some images are also projected on the floor - very interesting. Also, when a movie is over, you may stay because they show two different movies back to back.
Forced to buy tickets with the Flower Dome , beautiful waterfall and gardens but not as breath taking as the flower dome

We loved the Cloud Forest. It is cool, well designed and not too crowded when we went. The plants and flowers are interesting and often beautiful and it is fascinating walking the high level walkways leading down from the highest level giving a great view of the different aspects of the dome.
It is something different from the usual 'conservatories' that one sees in other places.
Well worth the entrance fee.

REVIEW_TITLE: A bit of tropical in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is worth a visit if not just for the refreshing cool off temperature. Really nice walk around and not too busy when we visited early morning
Thoroughly enjoyable experience and great to see the amazing work they are doing. The high level walkways are great vantage points and plants are interspersed with lovely carvings.
I have to say this is an amazing garden, each display of flowers were unique. The waterfall in the middle was amazing. A must to see if your in Singapore!
Went to Cloud Forest in the afternoon the visit takes about 2hrs we had a good time if you are in Singapore it’s a must place to visit
Incredible structure and building, floor displays and internal features amazing. Great place to visit at dusk, the lighting is amazing
There’s such a lot to see as title says it is amazing, there are several levels and walk ways to explore .lovely and cool to walk around too , we definitely recommend visiting here .

REVIEW_TITLE: wow - this will take your breath away
REVIEW_BODY: such an amazing display of water and plants, this is advertised as the highest indoor waterfall in the world at 33M. it is just fantastic. and then you take a lift to the top and walk back down on the forest walk. so well done - thank you singapore

This place is beautiful , they have cave and a ton of flowers if you visit it in apriñ or beginning may .. we were there and it was amazing to see that lots of flowers , the area with tulips is simply beautiful where theres a windmill and a small house as the ones in Holand .. also I was like wow with the orchid area and the cave where by the end they have carnivorous plants witb a small river .. it really is a spectacle withing an impresive archotecture buildings that worth totally the time spent there.. is a bit pricy and in the afternoon this can get crowded but worth it !! .. try to arrive by far at 10 or 11 and you will be fine .. but if you make it in the afyernoon then you can see outside the light trees that are near this area which are like magic!! ..

Beautiful man made environment. This was well worth the cost of the combined ticket. The waterfall, as you enter, is beautiful. We found the sculpture and carvings interesting, especially mixed in with the flowers.

The Cloud Forest bio-dome is an awesome space with skywalks wrapping around a vertical jungle, including with one of worlds tallest indoor waterfalls! This place is amazing! The entry fee was about £16, but this also included the adjacent Flower Dome! Worth every penny!
There's so many plants! Displayed beautifully.. With sculptures, water features, more plants...it was an absolute delight to walk, stroll around here...wish I lived closer..

Beautifully curated selection of tropical plants. It seemed rather small from the outside, but we actually spent a good three hours going round the bridges and corridors and admiring the beautiful plants. Definitely worth it.
lush vegetation of the tropical highlands & a tall waterfall in a soaring, contemporary greenhouse...
A must visit when you’re in Singapore! Worth the monies for the gardens and cloud forest!so many beautiful plants and flowers to see!
Super cool mountain with a 6 story tall water fall inside a glass dome covered in tropical flowers and plants. A must see

cloud forrest is one of its kind. Singapore keeps coming up with something new and extraordinary on every visit of mine. This is a must visit for the way it is planned, beauty of the flowers and the number of varieties of plants in the dome

An amazing piece of engineering and a spectacular piece of horticulture. This is a must while you are in Singapore, mind bowing waterfall, beautiful planting , fantastic orchids. You won’t see the like anywhere else Thank you
This is such an amazing structure with an incredible collection of plants. Truly beautiful. Entrance fee is payable but well worth the cost.

REVIEW_TITLE: What a superb visit & well worth the money
REVIEW_BODY: Although visiting Gardens on the Bay is free, visits to the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are chargeable by a combined entry ticket. We paid 28 Singapore dollars each for the adult entry ticket for both domes in April 2019. We were absolutely amazed by the Cloud Dome and spent a couple of hours there. It was easy to get around, even for families with children in pushchairs of for disabled persons as there are lifts as well as ramp walkways. Their collection of insectivorous plants was amazing and the whole dome was presented as a mountainous forest with waterfalls. It was so carfellly planned out and must take a lot of effort to maintain. There were many beautiful pieces of sculpture incorporated into the displays. Well worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cooling Rainforest in the tropical Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This great and beautiful Cloud Forest in the tropical Singapore is worthy of your visit in Singapore. You will get to enjoy this and quiet getaway unlike the Flower Dome which is just nearby. Nice and beautiful variety of flowers for your enjoyment and nature appreciation with cool breeze ambiance. Different themes are changed occasionally so worthy of visitation.

When we went to the gardens I expected just about that... gardens, though I knew there were a couple of domes, we went into the flower garden dome 1st and that was cool, the Cloud Forest usurped it just by the sheer number of plants, the variety and the spiral walkway.

Then to finish there were a couple movies and though the content was excellent about conservation and climate change, they should have had it showing either in other languages or include sub titles.

There were patrons from countries who blatantly disregard the welfare of the world and they should be made aware of these films content.

Truely wonderful place to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: so fresh inside so hot outside
REVIEW_BODY: very well realized a lot of plants and flowers that we don t know the view from the top is impressive well organized
Visited during the day and found it intriguing and a wonderful display. It’s cool so don’t get nervous about the heat. Tremendous video on global warming give food for thought.

It is worth seeing but remember to go early enough so you can get entry into both greenhouses. Last admission was about 8pm. There is basically a massive waterfall and lots of plants, It is quite nice and worth seeing.
Air conditioned so great on stinking hot days. Allow time to look at hidden sculptures and smaller plants.
This is worth a visit when in the area. The walkways throughout the dome are so great to give a good view of all the interesting trees.
A must see the two domes as they are just an eye opener to what man can do to make others more aware and the talents that people have to create such a space.
Beathtaking in concept excellent operation. Visually spectacular at the macro and micro level. A must see.
The waterfall at the cloud forest is quite spectacular. I combined this with a visit to the gardens and it was a great morning. The waterfalls were particularly impressive.

Cloud forest is in one of the domes of the gardens by the bay...the waterfall gives it a rainforest makeup...the various levels of walkways & species of flowers & wild vegetation is just so natural...the section of carnivorous plants was awsome...must visit for all tourists
For a botanic garden, this is a real gem. Worth every penny going in to see, you don't have to be a gardener or naturalist ot enjoy it, it is just worth seeing.

Was expecting something very commercial and busy, which it is BUT it is so incredibly well done! The scale of the dome is impressive and the plantings just blow your mind! This is really not to be missed. Loved the education parts too...although I think the conservation messaging needs to be in other languages too...not just English.....Japanese, Cantonese and Hindu maybe? The cloud walk is fabulous...and so many interesting plants and art pieces
Really fun to go through this place. Lots of great photo ops. People from all over the world enjoy this place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent and wide range of plants
REVIEW_BODY: Go in the morning before the hoards, well worth it. Great display and so many interesting plants. You will need at least 2 hours
If you are visiting the Gardens by the Bay, don't miss the Cloud Forest - an amazing area full of trees and plants showing the beauty of nature. You need an hour to visit it.
Wow what a waterfall and a great way to cool off. Such amazing plants. The waterfall is huge and creates a mystical environment when you walk in. Great visit -very calming.

With the heat of Singapore it was a relief to get inside this habitat. Greeted with a huge waterfall and then lead through a maze of wonderful exhibits, including beautiful orchids. All covers the importance of the forests and the consequences of man’s greed and carelessness. You have to visit!
Crowded during the weekend. A very nice place. When you walk the winding bridge at pre-dusk, that's the most beautiful moment.
Amazing gardens. Must see if in Singapore. Combine this with the whole Gardens at the Bay. highly recommend.

Having waited for the rain to clear to get into the park in the first instance, the cloud forest dome was perhaps less anticipated than the flower dome but certainly proved to be much much more interesting with its waterfalls and high level walks. Not to be missed when visiting the Marina Bay Park

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing garden elevated into the sky.
REVIEW_BODY:
Cloud Forest was just awesome with wonderful displays & elevated walkways was incredible taking you thru all the various levels.
This forest should be on your agenda when visiting this city.
Waterfall was amazing & the way the professional landscape gardeners have designed it, never seen anything like it.
Aussie Tourist.
Excellent place but yeah have to walk a lot and it is good for nature lovers ,has all type of flowers
It is a green place with millions of trees. You can walk slowly to enjoy the fresh air which you may not usually have else where.
Combined with the gardens this is well worth visiting. Not to be missed in Singapore. Just do it. The queue was a little long to get tickets but the big fan kept us comfortable while waiting.
Incredible & mind blowing, a sensational experience in a stunning environment. Totally recommend visiting!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great building.Look out for the carvings.
REVIEW_BODY: Magnificent structure, OK it's not a real waterfall, but really, what would you expect? As an experience it's right up there. However it's best to go when it's not too busy or you will end up waiting for a long time for the lift to the top but we both really enjoyed our visit, walking around the elevated walkways gives interesting views both within the dome and outside. The wooden carvings hidden around make it worth the visit on their own, especially the seat near to the exit and the dragons, the lions face and the old man. Didn't spend time with the stalactites as they were not what we came for but looked interesting but light wasn't good enough for pictures unlike the rest of it.Watch out for the carnivorous Lego.And it's cool, especially when it's hot outside, loads of photo opportunities, and loads of plants, maybe not flowers but interesting plants anyway.

This place is amazing and definitly worth the entry fee. It dosent matter if your not into plants! Just the sheer scale and considered design of this space is incredible. Highly recommended. Oh..you can get a double pass for this and the flower dome. Equally amazing.
Best tip I can give is arrive here first thing in the morning, the place is practically empty and you can get some great photos. Quite an eye opener, breathtakingly beautiful. September 2017

REVIEW_TITLE: Great effect of a natural waterfall
REVIEW_BODY: As soon as you enter you have this awesome sight of water cascading down from a significant height. Lot of foilage around it to give effect of a real waterfall. Walking around the waterfall is a great experience. Fantastic !

Went there during the day, is was amazing. But better come at night time for the light show. You can either take the mrt or taxi to get here. The garden its self is huge. We didn't managed to get on the sky bridge as it was noon time and it was hot. But night time this garden glows. Its definitely a place to visit and see
The cascade in this place is great, as all the other attractions in this place. Neat as a pin, great place to visit
If you're scared of heights you might want to rethink but you don't HAVE to walk across all the pathways. I managed with a bit of help!

REVIEW_TITLE: Same as Garden - a Must See
REVIEW_BODY: It is very crowded, indeed, but if you have time take a slow walk to the Cloud Forest. And have a look to each corner....
this was our favorite stop in Singapore. The displays are done so well with waterfalls and stairs and elevation levels to see things from different angles. It was so beautiful! I'd do it again.
Simply amazing, get a lift to the top down walk down the aerial walkway. Couldn’t stop taking photos.
This is part of the Gardens in the Bay area and a must see. Really spectacular to see all these plants too. Ingenious presentation of so many varied plants.

The Cloud Forest is one of the most fascinating botanical gardens I have ever had the pleasure of seeing! It is indescribable in words and must be seen. This exhibit, paired with the Flower Dome next door, are absolutely gorgeously beautiful and must be seen if you are in Singapore!!!!
We did not go at night but was told worth a trip but we had a very good day amazing what they have done and are still improving all the time .
it iis definately worth paying the money to go inside and see what they have achieved and understand how they recycle the water from place to place.
great creation as a money maker for the tourism department, not worth the wait and the horrendous ques to get anywhere. Dont waste your money

REVIEW_TITLE: Calm and a/c environment to visit during the day
REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Cloud dome with the Flower dome. It was the perfect place to visit during the day since it is cool with strong a/c. The misting is just ok, we walked from the top to the bottom and just cooled off inside the dome.

This place is a must go if you are in Singapore. Allow a couple of hours so you don’t have to rush as it is busy most of the times. I recommend you enjoy the atmosphere, take few photos and then truly enjoy yourself because this place is magical. It has such great vibe, the nature is vibrant and the environment has been developed to show us how our planet is gorgeous and what can be done to reduce our impact on the environment.

Amazing range of plants and trees from all over the world with excellent wood statues of animals and creatures. Well worth a visit and come early to avoid waiting to see each item. Sensory orchid plants to smell. Overall an enjoyable morning.

Be prepared to take lots of pictures in this stunning tropical paradise. I could not believe the size of the waterfall that greets you as you enter. The arial walks take you up ant through this amazing collection of plants. Do not miss a chance to put this on your to do list while in Singapore.
Go to this place eveery time we visit Singapore this place is absolutely amazing. You would not be dissapointed best to go late in the afternoon when it gets a bit cooler
Must see need a few hours to take photos The waterfalls, orchids, vertical garden were amazing do not miss going here its the best

REVIEW_TITLE: Escape the heat, worth the visit
REVIEW_BODY:
Totally enjoyed the cloud Forest and not just because it was cool and got me out of the heat and humidity!
It’s worth the $ to go in and have a look at all of the plant species that are in there.
Also liked the education aspect in relation to climate change, let’s hope it makes some change in any small way!
Have been to this place it looks its natural but its artificial... Really best amazing experience... Looks like your in natural environment.

Absolutely stunning and extremely well maintained.. Rainforest experience right in the centre of the City.. You get to see such wide variety of plant species all under one roof.. Please do no miss this marvel !!

Entering the cloud forest, you feel how cold it is inside because of the heat you have been enduring for the last couple of hours. The waterfall is about 2 - 3 storeys high, cascades down a rock wall with lovely plants jutting out along the way down. A suspended walkway takes above with an amazing view down. Some smaller waterfalls, ponds, beautiful garden of orchards & other plants.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great spot to explore and get away from the Singapore humidity
REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest is a great spot to visit, especially when it's hot and humid as it's nice and cool within the conservatory. Have a good look around the open area at entry level before going up to the higher levels in the lift as you can't get back! If you can time your visit arrive just before 10am, 12am or 2pm so that you experience the "misting" before going to the top

what a beautifully thought up place to visit.Singapore certainly has that wow factor ,although lots of people visiting you certainly had time to stand and reflect what was around you,we could not have been more happy to find this wonderful place to visit,

We first visited in early 2013, Gardens by the Bay had only been open for just over 7 months, so we were intrigued to return 6 years later and see how things had progressed. we were delighted to see how much was familiar to us, but also how things had grown.

The Cloud Forest is astonishing, from the moment you walk in and are gently splashed by the tallest indoor waterfall in the world (30 metres). You can wander around at your own pace as you descend through the surreal mist-filled Cloud Walk and Treetop Walk. The views from the top are astonishing, but possibly not for the fainthearted if you don't like heights! It's fantastic to see so many beautiful and exotic plants growing in this amazing space.

We were VERY impressed with the sky cloud, definitely something we'd return to in the future, especially to show friends through, it's a massive set up and would have cost heaps, but worth every dollar!

Went with my girlfriend and was thoroughly impressed. It is a lovely experience to walk around the cloud walk and to look down from the attic ideal waterfalls. There is also wonderful information in conservation and natural cloud forests

Well worth the entry fee to see this fabulous display, even if you are not a garden buff. Beautiful flowers particularly the orchids, lovely walkways with waterfalls and ponds and great rain-forest re-creation that was a real pleasure to wander through.
I really enjoyed visiting the cloud dome The manmade waterfall was outstanding and tbe walk among the clouds was exciting and the displays made for outstanding photos

I loved it! the view of the waterfall takes your breath away right when you enter the dome! it's a bit wet, but it is welcoming since the weather is pretty hot outside. the sight is amazing, and yes you have to stand in the line (sometimes line seems long, but it passes quickly) to "climb" up the hill. there are stairs inside of the hill like thing and even a small balcony where one can take a closer look at the waterfall. you will notice the balcony when you enter the venue, since there are lots of tourists like you taking selfies or just photos of the waterfall from the "balcony" There is also a bridge where you can walk around the "hill" it shakes a bit, so I hope you are not scared of the heights. Otherwise it is completely safe and I would trust Singaporean engineers with my life :) They don't do anything just to click done in the box. Everything is safe and secure.
Pretty impressive. Worth a look if its something you are interested in and won't get the chance to go to Ecuador

Strolling through this air conditioned maze was very pleasant, take the elevator to the “mountain” top and meander down on the walkways, quiet and clean and a great break from the outside heat...definitely recommend!
Amazing to visit it again, the views are spectacular from the tree canopy. Great to see the various plants growing throughout the structure.
We purchased tickets for both the Cloud Forest and Flower dome. We much preferred the Cloud Forest and would visit again, bit wouldn't bother with the Flower dome again.
One word......SENSATIONAL. Do not leave this out of your itinerary. Superb architecture and so interesting, the views from the top are simply amazing, loved it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloud forest - Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
Good to visit when the weather is hot. Cloud Forest is a mysterious world veiled in mist. Take in breath-taking mountain views surrounded by diverse vegetation and hidden floral gems. And learn about rare plants and their fast-disappearing environment.
Members of the Gardens by the Bay enjoy unlimited entries and free parking

REVIEW_TITLE: The best of Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Among the incredible and a must to any visitor, entering into the rain forest is like transporting to another world, where the beauty of a jungle can be enjoyed without a minor difficulty.

The Gardens by the Bay are very popular for all the right reasons. They offer a creative, environmentally friendly place and respite from the heat and humidity. They are easy to get to on the MRT (subway) and are interesting and enjoyable.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing man made internal waterfall and rainforest
REVIEW_BODY: Unbelievable, so many wonderful plants on display flowing around a man maid mountain with such a variety of beautiful rainforest plant. Definitely on the to do list.
Beautiful area with world known flowers and shrubs from everywhere and divided into countries and areas.Well exhibited and interesting.
A must see place if you are in Singapore, it is definitely a tourist stop and gets a little crowded afternoons . So if you want to take good pictures without people you should go early in the morning

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see when visiting the gardens by the bay!
REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest is like nothing I've ever seen before! Beautiful and there are loads of great photo opportunities.

The Gardens by the Bay and the Cloud Forest are a must for any visitors to Singapore. We picked the afternoon to visit so that we could stay in the evening to watch the spectacular lights show in the evening. The Cloud Forest is a must but you do go up quite a height. There is such a variety of exotic plants to see. And then in the evening around 1945hrs there is a spectacular light show to music in the Garden. Just pick a spot just to watch the incredible light show and music, totally mesmerising!
Nature,waterfalls and really a cloud forest made by modern Ingenuity.You have to walk up and it is worth it as the walk is gradual and not tiresome.

Add this to Gardens on the Bay and it is worth every Singapore cent. We took so many photographs - we are so glad phones have taken over from camera rolls, it would have cost us a fortune to develop them all. Must see in Singapore.
we have both been to the eden project but this is on another level an absolute wonder if in singapore you must visit

We recommend you include this in your package with the trees,
It is amazing place but not for the faint hearted if you don’t like heights. I hate then but force myself to go and so glad I did, unbelievable walkway through the trees. You don’t have to go on the walkway as there is a path on the ground that you can take to walk around. Would highly recommend.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool diversion on a hot day
REVIEW_BODY: Cloud forest display highlights a centrally located huge waterfall in the center of the dome. The air-conditioned environment is a nice break from the heat outside. You can take an elevator up to the top and then wind your way down through cloud Forest orchids, ferns and unusual plants. Walkways can be a bit crowded with tour groups, I would allow at least one hour for a leisurely exploration of this venue.
You'll be blown away by this. Put simply, it's amazing. The planting, sculpture's & the worlds highest indoor waterfall will leave you dumb struck.

Highly Recommend! Together with the Flower Dome it's not too expensive.

A must-do for any visit to Singapore is this stunning Cloud Forest dome. You start off at the base of the indoor waterfall, but as you're inside its somehow less humid and cooler than the outside world of Singapore.

There's plants, sculptures and cool-random things as you walk round the dome before heading up in the lift to the top where you get great views both of whats inside and outside the dome.

I also appreciate the poignant climate change messages that are spread throughout this dome, it does make you appreciate what we've got.
so well planned and set out and so cool during the hot humid weather. The waterfall is amazing and the spray cools you down,the orchids are breathtaking

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the World's tallest indoor Waterfall
REVIEW_BODY: The large, climate-controlled dome has spiralling walkways and one of the world’s tallest indoor waterfalls that rains down from over 30 metres above. It's exciting - bring your camera & enjoy.
What they have done here is awesome. This is a must see when visiting Singapore. The way they have created the waterfall and cloud mist is fantastic.

This is in a dome in Gardens of the bay.We had purchased tickets in our hotel which was slightly cheaper.Lovely displays of trees and flowers specially orchids.You climb quite high for a view over the forest.It was busy but loads of room for everyone.Worth a visit.

Absolutely loved this place... Especially how cool it was. So much to see, to take in. So many good photo opportunities, bit hard when busy although we managed to get some pretty awesome ones.. definitely worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Another place to keep coming back to.
REVIEW_BODY: I find it hard to explain to people sometimes, exactly what to expect here. The plant life is so variable, ranging from large flowers to minute orchids. You can walk up or down a large spiral walkway, circumnavigating the central ‘mountain’ of plant life. There is so much to see that return visits will always be rewarding.

The Cloud Forest includes humid but cooler climate zones that are better suited to some of the more temperate plant species. Great collection of many carnivorous plants (many Pitcher Plant species), along with orchids, and a wide range of other higher-altitude species. The mist generators on the elevated walkways provide a spectacular backdrop, and one can easily spend a large chunk of the day in this one building! Similar to the Flower Dome in some respects, but very different in others - so the two domes are very complementary. Obviously a must-see if visiting Gardens by the Bay!

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't worry, there is a lift to the top so you can walk down
REVIEW_BODY:
Complementing the Flower Dome this is another fantastic, must see venue. Amazing collection of trees etc but also a "cave" of minerals which is very well laid out.
Would be useful if labels were also displayed at the higher levels of the walkway. Will go back in a few years to see if they have pruned the Kauri, it is aiming for th3 roof!

As you enter from the Flower dome into the Cloud forest Dome, the waterfall splashes you with cold spray that cools you.
Thereafter as you climb the tropical forest level by level, you see the beauty of mother nature spread out in front of you.
As you climb, you learn so much.
By the time you complete your tour you feel humbled with the knowledge that you have gained.
There are 9 levels.
I loved the Crystal mountain most.
Never ever miss this experience.
Really hard review to write because one word sums it all up ,fantastic. It’s a real recommend and a good way to spend some time if the weather is stormy

If you do nothing else in Singapore visit the Cloud Forest located in Gardens by the Bay. Wonder at the largest indoor waterfall in south east Asia,make your way from the top of the dome through exotic plants, marvel at a crystal world then watch the thought provoking film about climate change and not be moved about the damage being done to our beautiful planet. Suitable for all ages and in a nice,cool temperate climate away from the outdoor heat. An amazing structure to while away the time.

This is an amazing place to visit, and had to be on everyone’s list of not to missed attractions. Easily accessible we arrived at 10am when it was reasonably quiet and spent over an hour wandering around. The environment is wonderful, the plants and trees are fascinating and well presented.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful gardens and a great place to cool off!
REVIEW_BODY: Makes you feel that you have walked into a tropical paradise. The mountain of plants looks like they have been there forever and the waterfalls complete the picture.

Cloud dome is a wonderful forest environment in a huge dome structure.

The temperature is cool, great after Singapore heat.

As you enter make your way through to the lifts and go the level 7. Then follow the various ramps and paths, escalators back to the bottom.

Lots of photo opportunities but the photos don’t do it justice.

We paid half price for tickets. Search internet, we used Vidi which was linked to Airasia.
Sounds of croaking frogs and trees illuminated and covered in foliage. Like scenery from the film Avatar
Make sure you be there when they start the misting. You will get a lot of good photos that are looking like screenshots from the Jurassic Park
The habitats that have been created here are incredible and the design and layout is first class. Well worth visiting!

Yes, the upfront entry$ might seem a bit much, but it is well worth every penny and you will understand why once you see the upkeep requirements and displays. Super clean and maintained. The eco/bio-spheres/dome[s] and gardens are fantastic even for those who can't raise a house plant! Guaranteed to please, even children with the waterfalls and walkways and displays or sculptures. Easy/recommended to get there by the MRT. A great walk even in the heat and once inside the domes, you are instantly cooled and entranced with the experience. Plan on 3 hours minimum to visit.

Is really amazing that in Singapore they can do this kind of nature place feel good when u look at nature taking over with the water droplets sound who love the nature they could come and see this amazing place I believe they take a good shot photo for Instagramer. I love it
This place is immaculate, we kept it for our last days visit and it was beautiful! I would recommend anyone to go! Do take note, there is a fair bit of walking involved inside the dome
The cloud forest is located in one of the glass domes in the Gardens by the Bay, the water fall and the walkways are excellent

This is our second trip to Singapore. The first time we went through the park but didn't take in the cloud forest as we didn't have time. We made sure we experienced them this time around.
